**Monday, January 27.** Daryl DeFord from Washington State University
will give a talk titled *Political Geometries: Analyzing Fairness in
Redistricting with Statistics* from 5-6 in Rocky 312. Tea time will be
from 4:30-5 in Rocky 305.

**Friday, January 31.** Austin MBaye (VC '24) from Northeastern
University will give a talk at our Math Colloquium. The talk is from 4-5
PM in Rocky 312. Tea time will be from 3:30-4 in Rocky 305.

**February 12-13.** The [Henry Seely White
lectures](https://pages.vassar.edu/mathstats/hsw-lecture-series/) this
year will be given by [Professor Xiao-Li
Meng](https://statistics.fas.harvard.edu/people/xiao-li-meng).

**Friday, February 21.** Dr. Jamie Juul from Colorado State University
will give a talk at our Math Colloquium. The talk is from 4-5 PM in
Rocky 312. Tea time will be from 3:30-4 in Rocky 305.

**April 11-13.** [DataFest](https://pages.vassar.edu/datafest/) is a
data analysis competition where teams of up to five students have a
weekend to attack a large, complex, and surprise dataset. Work together
with your team members and consult with mentors to find and communicate
insights into these data. The teams that impress the judges the most
will win prizes. Everyone else will have a great experience, learn some
new skills, and have fun! Registration for this year's event will soon
be available.
